tools

Class Utility

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.Utility

  • public class Utility
extends java.lang.Object
    the Utility class contains useful methods to initialize the folders and to modify the Word ArrayList, in order to modify them recycling the appropriate code.
    Author:
    Andrea Righi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Utility() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void clearDirectory()
      this method checks the init folder and deletes everything is contained by it, making sure that no result will be overwritten or modified by mistake.
      static java.util.ArrayList<Word> compute(java.util.ArrayList<Word> raw)
      this method is used to compute every Word ArrayList: it checks all the objects and modify the equal ones, by increasing their counter, modifying the title and the author fields.
      static void initialize()
      this method takes the init folder ("src/output") and creates it; then it creates the necessary folders to contain all the output files.
      static java.util.ArrayList<Word> setID(java.util.ArrayList<Word> a)
      this method establishes an unique ID to every Word object to highlight it and differentiates from each other.
      static java.util.ArrayList<Word> songList(java.util.ArrayList<Word> raw)
      a Facade method, used to perform all the necessary operations to a Word ArrayList
      static java.util.ArrayList<Word> sort(java.util.ArrayList<Word> a)
      this method is used to sort every Word ArrayList: it checks all the objects and orders them by their counter, in descending order.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Utility

        public Utility()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize()
        this method takes the init folder ("src/output") and creates it; then it creates the necessary folders to contain all the output files.

      • clearDirectory

        public static void clearDirectory()
        this method checks the init folder and deletes everything is contained by it, making sure that no result will be overwritten or modified by mistake.

      • sort

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Word> sort(java.util.ArrayList<Word> a)
        this method is used to sort every Word ArrayList: it checks all the objects and orders them by their counter, in descending order.
        Parameters:
        a - the ArrayList which needs to be checked
        Returns:
        the sorted ArrayList

      • setID

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Word> setID(java.util.ArrayList<Word> a)
        this method establishes an unique ID to every Word object to highlight it and differentiates from each other.
        Parameters:
        a - the ArrayList which needs to be checked.
        Returns:
        the ArrayList with the right IDs.

      • compute

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Word> compute(java.util.ArrayList<Word> raw)
        this method is used to compute every Word ArrayList: it checks all the objects and modify the equal ones, by increasing their counter, modifying the title and the author fields.
        Parameters:
        raw - the ArrayList which needs to be checked.
        Returns:
        the computed ArrayList.

      • songList

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Word> songList(java.util.ArrayList<Word> raw)
        a Facade method, used to perform all the necessary operations to a Word ArrayList
        Parameters:
        raw - the ArrayList which needs to be checked.
        Returns:
        the final ArrayList.
